title: For Sale:  KIDD Single Stage Trigger Assembly Ruger 10/22
postcontent:
Description:

 The KIDD single stage drop-in trigger unit. This design is adjustable from 1 1/2 pounds to 5 pounds with the turn of a plunger. It comes in silver or black anodized aluminum with a matching trigger blade. The redesigned bolt hold open and interchangeable magazine lever are standard. Our single stage trigger guard is CNC machined to Tony's specifications. The redesigned fit and closely held tolerances of the internal parts allow for the cleanest breaking single stage in the industry. An aftermarket auto bolt release is standard with our trigger.

How is this different from our two stage? This single stage more closely matched the traditional function of the Ruger trigger except with a refined feel and adjustability. Our two stage has a travel stage where the trigger blade moves rearward for about a 1/4 of an inch before it comes to the breaking stage. Because of this travel stage our two stage trigger is able to be reduced in weight to only 6 ounces versus the lowest weight for our single stage is 1 1/2 pounds.

More about this particular unit:

It is a used unit and does have some minor scratching.  The scratches are hidden when assembled and do not hinder performance of this unit.  It is the black model. title: For Sale:  Not your average Taurus 24-7
postcontent:
Up for sale is a rare nice condition Taurus 24-7  c ds Ti.
First off I must say this firearm has been great to me I carried it daily for over a year it has never let me down is a great shooter and is in overall great condition for a carry gun. So you may wonder what makes this gun so rare. well there are many first gen 247s out there it is fairly common for the full frame versions to have a built in decocking system it is far more uncommon for the compact versions to have such a feature this will allow you to decock it after loading a round in the chamber there for carrying it with a double action trigger for more peace of mind. very limited versions they put a titanium slide on the 247 now what makes this firearm rare is that it is the compact version with a titanium slide and decocker system. so what you have is a striker fired pistol capable of being decocked  in the compact lighter version with the titanium slide. Acording to taurus it looks like 2009 was the only year they made this guy with those 3 combinations in a very limited run of numbers. go ahead look for yourself will be very hard hard to find 1. in all the time I've had this gun I've only seen 1 with titanium and ds but it was a full frame. I know some people don't care for Taurus but i often carried this over my ruger sr9 or xd40sc I trust my life with this gun. comes with 1 13rd and 1 17rd magazines hardcase and manual. 350 firm. check out what other strikers fired pistols with decockers sell for p99s sw99s. Ftf cash must be 21 thanks

title: For Sale:  Scoped Russian Rifle
postcontent: This is one of a dozen made by a Nevada gunsmith for a gun club there. The idea was to provide a rifle for older gents to shoot cheap ammo without eye strain. Rifle is a nice 91/30 with laminated stock. Trigger lightened and a nice bent bolt installed. Scope is a modern Russian 4X with illuminated reticule. The scope mount is rigid and firmly attached to the receiver, not one of those flimsy rear sight jobs. Rifle is quite accurate with surplus ammo, no need to handload ! Outfit is well made and very solid. FTF only. Can arrange a trip to the range to try it out. Fun gun !

title: For Sale:  Safe Liquidation time...sadface
postcontent:
Well, i really hate to be having to make this post but money is starting to get tight and it is now time for me to downsize my collection of fine fire arms. Up for sale or trade is this used Bazooka EL 10-HP 10 inch Amplified Bass Tube. 

To produce bass, you need a sub, an enclosure, and an amplifier, and it can be little tricky to match them all up. A powered sub eliminates all the hassle, as the manufacturer designs the enclosure to house the sub and amp together. This all-in-one solution is especially useful in smaller vehicles, where there's no room to mount a separate amp, or in any vehicle where you need every bit of cargo space. 

The EL10A-HP 10" amplified Bazooka lets you add ride-filling bass to your system with a minimum of hassle. It's an ideal solution if you want the thrill of powerful bass but don't want to make many modifications to your vehicle.

title: For Sale/Trade:  *Free* - 80 rounds 6.5x55 Swedish Mauser blanks
postcontent: These are the famous "wooden bullet" 6.5x55 Swedish Mauser blank rounds.  Although they have wooden bullets, the bullets generally disintegrate when fired.  I was barely able to hit a target 5 yards away.  Nevertheless, DO NOT fire them at a person.  They are fired with tremendous power, and I'm sure the splinters alone could cause injury.  These should be used as blank rounds, as the wooden bullets are virtually useless.

title: For Sale/Trade:  *WINCHESTER M-37 .410 Single Shot*
location: NW OKCish, or thereabouts, Oklahoma City, Oklahoma
postcontent:
Here's a very nice little ol' Winchester Model 37 'Steelbuilt' in .410 guage.
The Model 37 Shotgun was one of Winchester's most popular guns of the last century, and remains today a very collectible, nostalgic, and sought after Winchester. These guns have a forged steel receiver and are of old fashioned quality. 
This is NOT the later '37a' Winchester and the only plastic part is the butt plate.
 This is the perfect gun for teaching the wife or a young gunner to hunt, and the longer barrel & full choke will reach out to small game or varmints. 
  I'd say it's about 70% finishwise, & a very solid shooter with strong ejection. With minimal care, it should last (another) lifetime.
 I prefer to sell/ trade locally- so let me know.

title: For Trade:  U.S. Army gear trade for???
postcontent: I have a decent amount of U.S. Army gear that I have no use for.  I recieved or purchased all of this while serving on active duty from 2001-2005.  The majority of this is new, never worn.  The stuff that is used seen a tour in south korea and 2 tours in Iraq.  My platoon was the first U.S. Army personell to invade Iraq at the begining of the war along with special forces and a batalion of marines to clear the path for the main body.  They were also  worn in the great sulfer mine fires of Iraq in 2003. So all that you see that is desert camo was on that movement.  I'm not saying that makes it worth anymore, i'm just sharing the history.  This collection includes: 2 duffel bags, 1 laundry bag, 1 NEW desert Gortex coat with tags still on it, 2 sand scarfs, 1 pair NEW desert boots, 1 pair NEW gortex boots, 2 pair used lether boots, 1 pair garrison shoes,  1 pair glove inserts,  2 BDU under shirts,  2 poly pro tops,  2 poly pro bottoms,  1 pair NBC gloves, 1 NBC hood, 1 NBC bag,  1 kevlar cover,  3 DCU tops,  3 DCU bottoms,  1 BDU bottom,  3 BDU tops,  1  NEW Garrison trench coat,  1 NEW field jacket,  1 set of dressed Class-A's tops and bottoms with belt,  2 LBV extenders to fit around frag jacket,  2 winter caps BDU/DCU,  1 winter PT jacket, 1 pair PT pants,  1 weapon cleaning kit pouch,  1 NEW beret, 1 used beret with unit crest,  1 E-tool case,  1 garrison cap,  1 3-pocket pouch for LBV, and 1 complete Combat life saver Medical bag filled with supplies. title: For Sale/Trade:  Sigarms Blaser Tactical 2 (.338 Lapua Mag) w/case
postcontent:
I am letting go of a brilliant firearm. I have a Like New Blaser Tactical 2 chambered in .338 Lapua that has had 20 rounds through it. Currently it just sits in the safe and doesn't get the use that it is meant for. If you're wanting to make a 1500 yard shot or further then THIS is the perfect rifle for you. Another great feature is the fact that you can change calibers on this rifle to other popular sniper rounds in under two minutes. The barrels and bolts needed are available online. Below is some good info about the rifle, and if you have ANY questions please feel free to ask.

***I'll consider a partial trade for top tier 1911 and/or AR***

The Tactical 2 is the most advanced version of the precision rifle developed by Blaser.
Each design element was driven by the requirement to create the best shooting platform
possible. Exceptional accuracy was one of the key principles during development, with
effective engagement ranges of 1500 meters or more, depending on caliber and
ammunition. Advanced engineering and uncompromising quality are evident in every facet
of design. The Tactical 2 is a bolt action rifle featuring Blaser’s revolutionary straight-pull
action. When the bolt is closed, the 360 degree radial collet expands into the locking
groove in the barrel – the bolt head is auto-centering and self-headspacing. The straight
pull action features no rotating parts and assures rapid reloading with minimum
movement. The rifle can easily be converted for left or right hand shooters. Interchange
calibers by replacing the barrel and bolt head, in under a minute, without special tools
and no change in accuracy. Barrels are cold hammer forged, fluted and plasma-nitrided to
provide maximum resistance against corrosion and abrasion. An M1913 Picatinny rail is
fixed to the barrel, ensuring full compatibility with a wide range of optical sighting
systems. The muzzle end is threaded for an optional muzzle brake. The receiver is
machined from aircraft grade billet aluminum alloy and is the interface for the barrel, bolt
assembly, trigger assembly and magazine. A recoil lug of hardened steel is integrated
into the receiver. The entire unit is fixed to the stock, eliminating temperature induced
distortion. The outer surface is hard anodized. The ergonomically correct stock is injection
molded out of fiber reinforced polymers and is absolutely stable, even under extreme
temperatures.

Specifications:

    Caliber: .338 LAPUA

title: For Sale:  Klarus XT 11 600 Lumen Tactical Light with Extras!
postcontent:
I have a LNIB Karus XT 11 light with the ED-10 Remote Pressure Switch, a Red Filter, Metal Picatinny Gun Mount, two 18650 Lithium-ion Batteries and the Klarus Lithium Ion Dual Battery Charger.

I purchased this light on a whim and have not used it except to play around with it. It has never been mounted on a gun. The batteries were charged only one time. This is an amazing light, super bright and lightweight. The specifications are below. Or you can check it out at the Kalrus website.

Comes with the box for the light, with all paperwork and accessories, the box for the charger and the case for the filter. The remote pressure switch and gun mount did not come with packaging.

Asking $100 (If you purchased everything new it would be about $175). Cash, FTF in the Littleton Area preferred. Not looking for any trades.

Specifically designed for military and self-defense applications, the Klarus XT11 outshines the competition with its extremely durable build, brilliant 600-lumen output, and stainless steel strike bezel that can be used to ward off attackers. Like its smaller cousin, the XT10, the XT11 uses Klarus's dual button tail switch that allows for one-handed control and easy access to its blinding strobe function. The strike bezel can also be unscrewed to attach other accessories like colored filters. If you want to weapon mount the XT11, it is fully compatible with the ED10 Remote Pressure Switch.


Features and Specifications:

Output/Runtime (ANSI Rated using single 18650 Battery):
High Mode: 600 Lumens/2.3 hrs
Medium Mode: 150 Lumens/7.3 hrs
Low Mode: 10 Lumens/295 hrs
Strobe Mode: 600 Lumens/4.4 hrs
Dimensions: 5.82" (148 mm) (L) x 1.37" (34.9 mm) (Head Diameter) x 1.0" (25.4 mm) (Body Diameter) x 1.03" (26.2 mm) (Tail Diameter)
Weight: 4.65 oz. (132 g) (Excluding battery)
Uses 2 x CR123A or 1 x 18650 or 2 x 16340 batteries
CREE XM-L (U2) LED (50,000 hour lifespan)
Working Voltage: 3.4-8.4 V
Water resistant to IPX-8 standards
Materials: aircraft grade aluminum body, toughened ultra-clear glass, textured orange peel reflector

title: For Sale:  Redfield Revenge  3-9x42
postcontent:
Introducing Revenge™ from Redfield, with optional Accu-Ranger® Ballistic System™.The built-in optical rangefinder means you never take your eye off the target. Just range, zoom and fire. Regardless of the distance—or the target’s size and shape—it’s like they’re standing right in front of you.


Accu-Ranger Reticle
As one of the first with bullet drop compensation, Redfield’s original Accu-Ranger pioneered the reticles we take for granted today. The new Accu-Ranger blends precise holdover points hunters need with a bold center that naturally leads the eye for fast shot placement at close quarters. 

The reticle comes with precise aiming points that work with most popular hunting loads. For many standard cartridges simply sight in at 200 yards with the center crosshair, and the remaining hold points are dialed in up to 500 yards. The bottom of the circle intersects the vertical crosshair at the 300-yard aim point, the dot is your hold for 400 yards, and the bottom post provides a 500-yard aiming point. For faster, magnum-caliber rifles shooting light bullets, you can sight in at 300 yards and have hold points for 400, 500, and 600 yards.

title: For Sale:  SOLD-Springfield Model 1873 Trapdoor Rifle  (1877)
postcontent:
Springfield US Model 1873 Rifle is in excellent condition
What I think I know about this Model 1873 Springfield Trapdoor rifle. 
I think the barrel and receiver are matching. On the barrel are the letters “F” above a “P” then further down on the receiver is a “P”. 
The ornate script "P" on the underside of the stock behind the butt-end of the trigger plate is the "Firing Proof" mark, often referred to as the "Circled-P" 
The ornate “ESA” cartouche on the stock means that Erskine S. Allin was the Master Armorer at the time of this rifles production. 
The serial number 74573 means that the weapon was made April-June of 1877. 
The initials “J.C ahead of the (P) are probably those of a worker in the stocking department. 
The price of $795.00 is to be paid in either cash or USPS money order only.
If I have to mail the rifle it will be $40 shipping. Normally the rifles ship for around $30 but every time mail a long rifle the cost is about $40

title: Want To Buy:  APPROX. 54 DEALER ADS IS LIKE A PERSONAL STORE FRONT ON ARMSLIST? RIDICULOUS!!
location: SOUTH CAROLINA, South Carolina, United States
postcontent:
YES, DEALERS AND PRIVATE INDIVIDUALS CAN POST ADS TO ARMSLIST.

HOWEVER, WHEN A DEALER USES MOST OF 3 PAGES FOR APPROX. 54 ADS FOR THEIR PERSONAL BUSINESS ADS, THEN THAT SHOULD BE INCONSIDERATE TO OTHERS POSTING, AND MISSING THE SPIRIT OF ARMSLIST AD LISTINGS.

THIS IS THE FIRST TIME IN YEARS THAT I HAVE SEEN SUCH INCONSIDERATE MASS POSTING OF ADS BY A PERSONAL BUSINESS.

A GOOD DEALER PRACTICE OF POSTING  2 OR 3 ADS FOR SPECIAL DEALS OR OFFERINGS ARE MUCH MORE CONSIDERATE TO ALL.

title: Want To Buy:  .40 to .45 caliber handgun in the price range of $800-$1,000.
postcontent:
If you get what you pay for, then I want a gun worth every cent. Nothing more, nothing less. For the price I'm offering, I could probably go to a gun store and buy a brand new one myself. But it's doubtful I'd be able to find the variety of guns in that store that I can find on ARMSLIST. Last time I checked, Vance's didn't carry a Beretta CX4 Storm semi-automatic rifle in their inventory. I was hoping to find a gun like that, too. Something special that has been well taken care of that is modern. Let's say, created and produced within the last ten years? Even if it's a remake of an old classic, as long as it's modern, accurate and something I can take to the shooting range and enjoy or even file for a concealed weapon license and use it as the gun I'll be holstering. My father has had several heart surgeries and most recently a tripler bypass, as far as I know, he's also looking for a gun that fits my description. So, I don't care if it's two matching guns or two separate guns, as long as they fall under the criteria of being worth what I'm asking, legally able to be registered as a concealed weapon and fairly high caliber. My Dad is unable to protect himself with his hands anymore and I work at his business.

So, here's what I'm after, two similar guns. Personally, I want a unique gun. My father just needs one for protection. I could stand to know more about guns, but I want something accurate for both guns. No one wants to ever have to fire a gun, but if you locate your business in a bad neighborhood, you never know what'll happen and that is what concerns me.

Thank you for your time.

title: For Sale:  Armalite AR-7 Israeli Military 22lr
postcontent:
See you at Big Boy's Gun Show March 16 in Stover Missouri.

Pix #1 In the late 1960's Israel ordered an unknown quantity of Armalite AR-7 22lr cal semi auto survival rifles. They made the various modifications pictured here, provided a canvas roll bag. The set was then strapped to the ejection seat in their fighter aircraft. A few years ago less than 200 of them were imported into the U.S.

Pix #2, Among the Israeli modifications was to shorten the barrel to 13 inches. Before the importer could re-sell the guns he had to attach the 3 inch simulated muzzle break to bring it back out to a legal minimum 16".

Pix #3, Nearly all the changes made to the gun were done with pre-existing parts. Note the grip is for an FAL. Forward sling swivel is for an L1A1. I'm not sure what the canvas sling was used on but it is original to the gun.

Pix #4, Close up of the barrel just ahead of the chamber. Note the serial numbered on the barrel not done on factory Armalites. Also the importer's stamp under The Armalite address.(not shown)

Pix #5, Barrel removed & stock collapsed. Package length would have been 13" had the 3" barrel extension not been added for legality. Note the front sight, it's for a K98 Mauser!(not shown)

Liquidating my 30 year private collection. Everything I don't actually use must go. 

Will trade for: Military guns, vehicles, radios. M1 Carbine Enforcer pistol, TC Contender barrels in 45acp & 30 carbine, 50bmg repeater, 357 pistol 4" adjustable sights, 357 mag "Mare's Leg" or "Ranch Hand". Ham radio equipment(KB0SFP).
